name: Palak Chapati / spinach chapathi recipe
description: Easy , healthy palak chapathi / Spinach chapathi recipe with step by step photos - Easy, instant dinner recipes
keywords: Palak chapati, spinach chapathi, spinach chapathi recipe, palak chapati recipe, soft palak paratha, palak paratha recipe, easy palak paratha
ingredients: Ajwain/ Carom seeds OR cumin seeds - 1 tsp

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and clean the palak leaves. Grind the leaves, green chilli and ginger to a smooth paste adding required water. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.html: Wash and clean the palak leaves. Grind the leaves, green chilli and ginger to a smooth paste adding required water. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a wide plate or bowl, take the whole wheat flour, ajwain, ground palak, curd, cooking oil, salt, garam masala powder and mix well.
recipeInstructions.html: In a wide plate or bowl, take the whole wheat flour, ajwain, ground palak, curd, cooking oil, salt, garam masala powder and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add little water only if needed. Make a smooth dough.Knead for 5 minutes. Grease with oil. Cover & rest for 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.html: Add little water only if needed. Make a smooth dough.Knead for 5 minutes. Grease with oil. Cover & rest for 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: After 30 minutes, make ball sized dough and dust in wheat flour.Roll it thin or thick as you like. I rolled it medium thick.
recipeInstructions.html: After 30 minutes, make ball sized dough and dust in wheat flour.Roll it thin or thick as you like. I rolled it medium thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a dosa pan. Put the chapati and cook in low to medium flame. When bubbles start to appear, flip the chapati and cook the other side. Apply oil on both the sides by flipping the chapathi.
recipeInstructions.html: Heat a dosa pan. Put the chapati and cook in low to medium flame. When bubbles start to appear, flip the chapati and cook the other side. Apply oil on both the sides by flipping the chapathi.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove and serve hot with onion raita or boondi raita.Enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html:
Remove and serve hot with onion raita or boondi raita.
Enjoy !

name: How to make bread pizza on tawa, oven and microwave

image.title: How to make bread pizza on tawa, oven and microwave
image.alt: How to make bread pizza on tawa, oven and microwave

description: Easy, yummy, kids friendly bread pizza recipe on tawa/stove top, convection oven and microwave methods
keywords: Bread pizza, bread pizza recipe, bread pizza in microwave, bread pizza in tawa, how to make bread pizza in tawa,bread pizza without oven, bread pizza microwave, microwave bread pizza recipe
ingredients: Grated Cheese - 1/2 cup to 1 cup ( I used Amul Mozzarella cheese)
Pizza sauce or paste sauce or schezwan chutney - as needed ( I used pizza sauce around 3-4 tbsp)
Oregano mix or pizza seasoning mix - 1 tsp
Butter - to grease the tawa & bread

recipeInstructions.text: To make bread pizza, wash and chop all the vegetables finely. Grate the cheese and keep aside.Take a bread slice and apply butter on both the sides.Keep in a plate.
recipeInstructions.html: To make bread pizza, wash and chop all the vegetables finely. Grate the cheese and keep aside.Take a bread slice and apply butter on both the sides.Keep in a plate.

recipeInstructions.text: In a wide bowl, mix all the finely chopped vegetables, pepper powder, salt and pizza seasoning mix.Keep it ready.Take the bread slice and apply the pizza sauce on one side.Spread the mixed vegetables. Top with grated cheese. You can either cook them on tawa/pan, microwave or bake in convection oven.
recipeInstructions.html:
In a wide bowl, mix all the finely chopped vegetables, pepper powder, salt and pizza seasoning mix.Keep it ready.
Take the bread slice and apply the pizza sauce on one side.Spread the mixed vegetables. Top with grated cheese. You can either cook them on tawa/pan, microwave or bake in convection oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Bread pizza in tawa : Heat a dosa tawa and apply some butter. Keep the loaded bread slice.Cover cook in very low flame for 3-4 minutes or until the cheese melts.Remove in a plate and serve hot. Cover cook is very important. If you don’t cover cook, cheese won’t melt and bottom of bread slice may burn.
recipeInstructions.html: Bread pizza in tawa : Heat a dosa tawa and apply some butter. Keep the loaded bread slice.Cover cook in very low flame for 3-4 minutes or until the cheese melts.Remove in a plate and serve hot. Cover cook is very important. If you don’t cover cook, cheese won’t melt and bottom of bread slice may burn.

recipeInstructions.text: Bread pizza in microwave : Place the bread slice in microwave and cook in high power( mine is 800w) for 1 minute or until cheese melts.If the power is less, it may take 1.5 to 2 minutes. If power is more, it can be done under 1 minute.So keep an eye.
recipeInstructions.html: Bread pizza in microwave : Place the bread slice in microwave and cook in high power( mine is 800w) for 1 minute or until cheese melts.If the power is less, it may take 1.5 to 2 minutes. If power is more, it can be done under 1 minute.So keep an eye.

recipeInstructions.text: Bread pizza in convection oven : Preheat convection oven in 180c. Keep the bread pizza in a baking tray. Bake it for 5 minutes at 180c. Cheese melts and the sides of bread slice turns slightly crispy. Remove and enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html: Bread pizza in convection oven : Preheat convection oven in 180c. Keep the bread pizza in a baking tray. Bake it for 5 minutes at 180c. Cheese melts and the sides of bread slice turns slightly crispy. Remove and enjoy !

name: Cauliflower Poriyal Recipe / South Indian Gobi Poriyal Recipe

image.title: Cauliflower Poriyal Recipe / South Indian Gobi Poriyal Recipe
image.alt: Cauliflower Poriyal Recipe / South Indian Gobi Poriyal Recipe

description: Cauliflower Poriyal - side dish for sambar & rasam rice
keywords: Cauliflower poriyal recipe, cauliflower poriyal, gobi poriyal, south indian cauliflower poriyal recipe, cauliflower recipes, gobi recipes
ingredients: Garam masala powder - 1/2 tsp ( optional, I din't add)

recipeInstructions.text: Take the cauliflower, remove the florets. If the florets are big, chop and make it small. Boil 5 cups of water adding turmeric powder & little salt. When the water starts to roll boil, switch off the flame. Add the cauliflower florets and rest for 5 to 10 minutes. Drain the excess water and collect the parboiled cauliflower.Set aside.
recipeInstructions.html: Take the cauliflower, remove the florets. If the florets are big, chop and make it small. Boil 5 cups of water adding turmeric powder & little salt. When the water starts to roll boil, switch off the flame. Add the cauliflower florets and rest for 5 to 10 minutes. Drain the excess water and collect the parboiled cauliflower.Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a kadai and splutter mustard seeds, urad dal and cumin seeds. Add finely chopped onion, ginger-garlic paste, curry leaves. Saute till raw smell goes off.
recipeInstructions.html: Heat oil in a kadai and splutter mustard seeds, urad dal and cumin seeds. Add finely chopped onion, ginger-garlic paste, curry leaves. Saute till raw smell goes off.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chopped tomato & saute until mushy(It is not shown in the picture) Add turmeric powder, salt & red chilli powder. Mix well for a minute.
recipeInstructions.html: Add chopped tomato & saute until mushy(It is not shown in the picture) Add turmeric powder, salt & red chilli powder. Mix well for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Lastly add the parboiled cauliflower florets, 1/4 to 1/2 cup of water. Mix well & simmer the flame. Cover cook for 5 to 10 minutes till cauliflower becomes soft & well cooked.Check for taste, add more salt & chilli powder if needed.
recipeInstructions.html: Lastly add the parboiled cauliflower florets, 1/4 to 1/2 cup of water. Mix well & simmer the flame. Cover cook for 5 to 10 minutes till cauliflower becomes soft & well cooked.Check for taste, add more salt & chilli powder if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves. Serve with rice, sambar or rasam.
recipeInstructions.html: Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves. Serve with rice, sambar or rasam.

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html: Enjoy !

name: Lemon sevai recipe - Instant lemon sevai using rice vermicelli

image.title: Lemon sevai recipe - Instant lemon sevai using rice vermicelli
image.alt: Lemon sevai recipe - Instant lemon sevai using rice vermicelli

description: How to make lemon sevai using instant rice vermicelli/rice noodles for easy breakfast or dinner
keywords: Lemon sevai, lemon sevai recipe, how to make lemon sevai, instant lemon sevai, rice vermicelli recipes, how to make lemon sevai using instant vermicelli, instant rice vermicelli recipes
ingredients: Rice vermicelli - 200gms packet ( I used Anil brand)
Cooking oil or gingely oil - 2 tbsp
Lemon juice - 2 tbsp or as needed
Water - 1 tbsp to add in lemon juice

recipeInstructions.text: Roll boil 4 cups of water adding few drops of cooking oil. Squeeze two small lemon and take the juice.Discard the seeds. Add 1to 2 tbsp water to it. Mix well and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.html: Roll boil 4 cups of water adding few drops of cooking oil. Squeeze two small lemon and take the juice.Discard the seeds. Add 1to 2 tbsp water to it. Mix well and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the vermicelli in a wide bowl and add the boiled water. Level of water should be 1 inch above the vermicelli. Cover & soak it for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.html: Take the vermicelli in a wide bowl and add the boiled water. Level of water should be 1 inch above the vermicelli. Cover & soak it for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the excess water completely using a colander and keep the cooked rice vermicelli ready. It should be fluffy.
recipeInstructions.html: Drain the excess water completely using a colander and keep the cooked rice vermicelli ready. It should be fluffy.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a kadai,splutter mustard, urad dal, chana dal, peanuts, red chilli, green chilli and curry leaves.Saute till dals become golden. Add the turmeric powder, required salt, lemon juice.Mix well and switch off the flame.
recipeInstructions.html: Heat oil in a kadai,splutter mustard, urad dal, chana dal, peanuts, red chilli, green chilli and curry leaves.Saute till dals become golden. Add the turmeric powder, required salt, lemon juice.Mix well and switch off the flame.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked rice vermicelli to it. Mix gently using a fork like ladle. Check for taste and add more lemon juice if needed. If the vermicelli looks too wet, cook in very low flame for 2 minutes till all the moisture goes off. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot for best taste !
recipeInstructions.html: Add the cooked rice vermicelli to it. Mix gently using a fork like ladle. Check for taste and add more lemon juice if needed. If the vermicelli looks too wet, cook in very low flame for 2 minutes till all the moisture goes off. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot for best taste !

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html: Enjoy !

name: Homemade Bajji, Bonda Mix Recipe
description: – How to make bajji, bonda mix recipe at home
keywords: Khoya kaju gravy, Khoya kaju curry, khoya kaju gravy recipe, khoya kaju curry recipe, cashew curry, cashew gravy, Khoya kaju, Khoya kaju recipe, restaurant style khoya kaju
ingredients: Red Chilli Powder –  1.5 to 2 tbsp (Adjust based on spice level)
Vegetables like onion, potato, brinjal, raw banana
Cooking soda or baking soda – a pinch

recipeInstructions.text: In a wide bowl, mix the besan flour, rice flour, red chilli powder, cumin seeds or ajwain, salt, food color ( if using) and mix well. If you want, you can sieve the flour, salt, chilli powder for uniform mixing and then add cumin seeds. Adding soda in the mix makes the bajji absorb more oil while frying.So add  soda while making bajji.
recipeInstructions.html: In a wide bowl, mix the besan flour, rice flour, red chilli powder, cumin seeds or ajwain, salt, food color ( if using) and mix well. If you want, you can sieve the flour, salt, chilli powder for uniform mixing and then add cumin seeds. Adding soda in the mix makes the bajji absorb more oil while frying.So add  soda while making bajji.

recipeInstructions.text: To make bajji or bonda : Take the required quantity of bajji mix in a bowl.Add a pinch or dash of cooking soda. Mix well.Add water to make a slightly thick batter. If the batter is too thick, vegetables won’t get coated properly. If the batter is thin, bajji will have tails. So add water gradually. Dip the vegetable in the batter, deep fry till golden in color. Please refer my ONION BAJJI RECIPE & POTATO BONDA for more details.
recipeInstructions.html: To make bajji or bonda : Take the required quantity of bajji mix in a bowl.Add a pinch or dash of cooking soda. Mix well.Add water to make a slightly thick batter. If the batter is too thick, vegetables won’t get coated properly. If the batter is thin, bajji will have tails. So add water gradually. Dip the vegetable in the batter, deep fry till golden in color. Please refer my ONION BAJJI RECIPE & POTATO BONDA for more details.

recipeInstructions.text: To make onion pakoda : Take the required quantity of bajji mix in a wide bowl.Add thinly sliced onion and mix well. Rest for 5 minutes. Add water and make a thick paste. Onions should be coated well. Add some hot oil and make pakoda. I will try to make a detailed post soon. Check out my Millet flour onion pakoda if interested.
recipeInstructions.html: To make onion pakoda : Take the required quantity of bajji mix in a wide bowl.Add thinly sliced onion and mix well. Rest for 5 minutes. Add water and make a thick paste. Onions should be coated well. Add some hot oil and make pakoda. I will try to make a detailed post soon. Check out my Millet flour onion pakoda if interested.

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html: Enjoy !

name: Rava Pongal Recipe - Sooji Pongal
description: How to make rava pongal recipe - Easy, yummy South Indian breakfast recipe
keywords: Rava pongal, rava pongal recipe, sooji pongal, sooji pongal recipe, semolina pongal, rava pongal recipe with video, rava recipes
ingredients: Semolina / Sooji / Rava - 3/4 cup ( Upma rava)
Water - 2 cups ( for dal) + 2.5 cups ( for rava)
Cashew nuts - 5 nos ( break into two)

recipeInstructions.text: In a pressure cooker base, heat 1 tsp of ghee and roast the moong dal till nice aroma comes out. Add 1 cup of water and pressure cook in very low flame for 2 whistles. Open the cooker once its done and mash the dal.
recipeInstructions.html: In a pressure cooker base, heat 1 tsp of ghee and roast the moong dal till nice aroma comes out. Add 1 cup of water and pressure cook in very low flame for 2 whistles. Open the cooker once its done and mash the dal.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a kadai and dry roast the rava in medium flame for 5 minutes. Take care, Rava should not burn. Transfer it to a plate.
recipeInstructions.html: Heat a kadai and dry roast the rava in medium flame for 5 minutes. Take care, Rava should not burn. Transfer it to a plate.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same kadai, heat ghee and add pepper corns.When the pepper corns starts to splutter, add finely chopped ginger, cashews and curry leaves. When the cashews start to turn golden, add cumin seeds and hing.
recipeInstructions.html: In the same kadai, heat ghee and add pepper corns.When the pepper corns starts to splutter, add finely chopped ginger, cashews and curry leaves. When the cashews start to turn golden, add cumin seeds and hing.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix well and add water 2.5 cups of  water immediately ( I used 1:3 ratio of rava & water). Add the required salt, cooked moong dal in the water.
recipeInstructions.html: Mix well and add water 2.5 cups of  water immediately ( I used 1:3 ratio of rava & water). Add the required salt, cooked moong dal in the water.

recipeInstructions.text: When the water starts to roll boil, simmer the flame completely or switch off the flame if you are a beginner. Add the roasted rava slowly in one hand while mixing the water in other hand. This is most important to avoid lump formation.
recipeInstructions.html: When the water starts to roll boil, simmer the flame completely or switch off the flame if you are a beginner. Add the roasted rava slowly in one hand while mixing the water in other hand. This is most important to avoid lump formation.

recipeInstructions.text: After the rava is mixed well with water, it becomes thick. Cover & cook for 5 minutes in low flame. Open the lid and mix it once. Again cover cook for 2 minutes till rava becomes soft and well cooked.
recipeInstructions.html: After the rava is mixed well with water, it becomes thick. Cover & cook for 5 minutes in low flame. Open the lid and mix it once. Again cover cook for 2 minutes till rava becomes soft and well cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1tbsp of ghee at the end, mix well and switch off the stove. Initially, when the pongal is hot, it looks mushy. But it will become non-sticky and stay soft when it becomes warm. Serve with your favorite side dish like coconut chutney or gosthu.
recipeInstructions.html: Add 1tbsp of ghee at the end, mix well and switch off the stove. Initially, when the pongal is hot, it looks mushy. But it will become non-sticky and stay soft when it becomes warm. Serve with your favorite side dish like coconut chutney or gosthu.

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html: Enjoy !

name: Easy Sambar Sadam - Bacehlors Style Sambar Rice Recipe

image.title: Easy Sambar Sadam - Bacehlors Style Sambar Rice Recipe
image.alt: Easy Sambar Sadam - Bacehlors Style Sambar Rice Recipe

description: How to make Sambar Rice Recipe easily in a pressure cooker - One pot rice variety
keywords: sambar sadam, sambar rice, sambar sadam recipe, sambar rice recipe, easy sambar sadam, easy sambar rice, sambar rice in a pressure cooker, how to make sambar rice
ingredients: Raw rice or Steamed rice - 1 cup
Toor dal - 1/3 cup ( You can use 1/4 to 1/2 cup)
**Mixed Vegetables - 1 cup ( 1 small carrot, 1/2 radish, 1 brinjal, Beans 3 nos, broad beans 5 nosl)
Ripe Tomato - 3 nos ( finely chopped, I used 2 big tomato)

recipeInstructions.text: Wash rice & toor dal.Drain the water & Set aside. Wash & chop all the required vegetables.
recipeInstructions.html: Wash rice & toor dal.Drain the water & Set aside. Wash & chop all the required vegetables.

recipeInstructions.text: In a pressure cooker base, heat oil and splutter mustard seeds, methi seeds,curry leaves and coriander leaves. Saute for a second. Add sliced onion, slit green chilli and saute till onion turns transparent.
recipeInstructions.html: In a pressure cooker base, heat oil and splutter mustard seeds, methi seeds,curry leaves and coriander leaves. Saute for a second. Add sliced onion, slit green chilli and saute till onion turns transparent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add finely chopped tomato, mix well.Add turmeric powder, hing, sambar powder, red chilli powder, dhania powder and salt. Saute in medium flame till tomato turns mushy. Do not burn the masala.( Tamarind extract is not needed for this recipe)
recipeInstructions.html: Add finely chopped tomato, mix well.Add turmeric powder, hing, sambar powder, red chilli powder, dhania powder and salt. Saute in medium flame till tomato turns mushy. Do not burn the masala.( Tamarind extract is not needed for this recipe)

recipeInstructions.text: Lastly add the chopped vegetables.Saute for a minute. Add the washed rice, dal and 5 cups of water. Mix well and check for taste.Add more salt, chilli powder or sambar powder if needed.
recipeInstructions.html: Lastly add the chopped vegetables.Saute for a minute. Add the washed rice, dal and 5 cups of water. Mix well and check for taste.Add more salt, chilli powder or sambar powder if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the cooker and pressure cook for 2 whistles in very low flame.Open the cooker after steam is released. Mix well. ( If you want to add tamarind extract, add it now, boil for a minute till its raw smell goes off).Don't forget to garnish with chopped coriander leaves and add 1 tbsp of ghee. Serve hot with chips, papad or pickle if you like !
recipeInstructions.html: Close the cooker and pressure cook for 2 whistles in very low flame.Open the cooker after steam is released. Mix well. ( If you want to add tamarind extract, add it now, boil for a minute till its raw smell goes off).Don't forget to garnish with chopped coriander leaves and add 1 tbsp of ghee. Serve hot with chips, papad or pickle if you like !

name: Bread Roll Recipe - Potato stuffed bread rolls recipe

image.title: Bread Roll Recipe - Potato stuffed bread rolls recipe
image.alt: Bread Roll Recipe - Potato stuffed bread rolls recipe

description: How to make potato stuffed bread rolls recipe at home
keywords: bread roll, bread rolls, bread roll recipe, bread rolls recipe, how to make bread roll, stuffed bread roll recipe,potato stuffed bread roll, kids snacks recipes, kids recipes, snacks recipes, bread recipes
ingredients: Cooking oil - to deep fry the bread roll

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and pressure cook potato & green peas. Peel the potato, mash & keep aside.Finely chop the onion, ginger and garlic. Mix maida + corn flour in a bowl with little water and make a paste. Keep the bread crumbs in a plate and set aside.
recipeInstructions.html: Wash and pressure cook potato & green peas. Peel the potato, mash & keep aside.Finely chop the onion, ginger and garlic. Mix maida + corn flour in a bowl with little water and make a paste. Keep the bread crumbs in a plate and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Lets make potato stuffing. For this, heat oil in a pan. Saute finely chopped onion, garlic and ginger pieces. After onion becomes transparent, add the mashed potato, cooked green peas, salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and garam masala powder. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.html: Lets make potato stuffing. For this, heat oil in a pan. Saute finely chopped onion, garlic and ginger pieces. After onion becomes transparent, add the mashed potato, cooked green peas, salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and garam masala powder. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix till raw smell of powder vanishes. Switch off the flame after the masala thickens like a dough.
recipeInstructions.html: Mix till raw smell of powder vanishes. Switch off the flame after the masala thickens like a dough.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with coriander leaves and sprinkle some lemon juice.Mix well and set aside to cool down.
recipeInstructions.html: Garnish with coriander leaves and sprinkle some lemon juice.Mix well and set aside to cool down.

recipeInstructions.text: Now take a bread slice and trim off the edges. Dip the slice in water and squeeze it well by keeping them between your palm.
recipeInstructions.html: Now take a bread slice and trim off the edges. Dip the slice in water and squeeze it well by keeping them between your palm.

recipeInstructions.text: Make a oval shaped ball of potato masala and place it in the middle of squeezed bread.Seal all the corners and press to make oval shape rolls or cylinder shaped rolls. Dip in maida paste and roll in bread crumbs. This makes the rolls crispy. To make soft bread rolls, do not roll in maida paste & bread crumbs.
recipeInstructions.html: Make a oval shaped ball of potato masala and place it in the middle of squeezed bread.Seal all the corners and press to make oval shape rolls or cylinder shaped rolls. Dip in maida paste and roll in bread crumbs. This makes the rolls crispy. To make soft bread rolls, do not roll in maida paste & bread crumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Repeat and arrange all the rolls in a plate. Heat cooking oil to deep fry. Drop 2 to 3 rolls in oil and deep fry both the sides till golden. Remove in a tissue and enjoy hot with tomato ketchup.
recipeInstructions.html: Repeat and arrange all the rolls in a plate. Heat cooking oil to deep fry. Drop 2 to 3 rolls in oil and deep fry both the sides till golden. Remove in a tissue and enjoy hot with tomato ketchup.

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy !
recipeInstructions.html: Enjoy !
